page.title: 02FARMING Essex/Cambs Border
page.content: Farming is mainly arable _ barley, wheat with a little oats, sugar beet and break crops of peas, beans and vetches with grass for grazing. Most fields are between 30 and 40 acres, bounded by roads or hedges. There are 3 small herds of cattle for fattening and 1 of Jersey cows. Sheep numbers are declining due to lack of special- ised labour although 2 farmers have small flocks and 1 has a larger flock of fat lambs. 3 farms are about 300 acres and 3 farms are over 600 acres. 5 are mainly family concerns, 1 farmer lives outside the area and manages it with other land. There is an inten- sive egg farm.
